Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the incident by stating that "several Muslim men fired upon a number of Californian hikers." The actual reporting from the Los Angeles Times and law enforcement sources does not mention any firing or targeting of hikers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on unreliable web sites and conspiracy theories rather than verified facts or credible sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the media covered up the incident, but there is no evidence or explanation provided for why the media would do so.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation provided by the Los Angeles Times and law enforcement sources, which state that the armed men were cooperative and did not engage in any firing or shouting of "Allahu Akbar."
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the reporting from the Los Angeles Times, which does not mention any Muslim men firing at hikers or a cover-up by the media.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on unreliable web sites and conspiracy theories rather than verifiable facts or credible sources.
